body_html:
If you have your own docker build process, you can always update your dockerfiles to remove the non-ssl repos and add the ssl repos manually before you run any apt commands.
Our policy is to only update previous releases in the case of critical bugs.
As I can clearly see a workaround here, I think we will not update our previous releases.
body_text:
If you have your own docker build process, you can always update your dockerfiles to remove the non-ssl repos and add the ssl repos manually before you run any apt commands.
Our policy is to only update previous releases in the case of critical bugs.
As I can clearly see a workaround here, I think we will not update our previous releases.
body:
If you have your own docker build process, you can always update your dockerfiles to remove the non-ssl repos and add the ssl repos manually before you run any apt commands.
Our policy is to only update previous releases in the case of critical bugs.
As I can clearly see a workaround here, I think we will not update our previous releases.
